Cutoff of email will be annual by fiscal year.Cutoff for OIG Capstone officials will occur at the end of the fiscal year (September 30) and transfer to NARA 15 years later.

Capstone Officials: Top-Level Agency Resources email records are considered permanent records and will be retained for 15 years before being transferred to NARA. Cut-off annually at the end of each calendar year. Non-Capstone Officials:  All other Agency personnel to include administrative personnel and employees and contractors will be retained under the General Records Retention Schedule (GRS),  item 11.  This category includes all email records considered temporary records and will be retained for 7 years.  Cut-off at the end of each calendar year.  Delete when 7 years old.  These email records will never be transferred to NARA, but deleted at the end of their retention period.  Exceptions:  Agency Examiners and Examining Attorneys,  and other Office of General Counsel employees as determined by OGC authorized personnel where email records are considered a temporary record will be retained for 20 years.  Cut-off at the end of each calendar year.  Delete when 20 years old.  Email records identified in this category will never be transferred to NARA, but deleted at the end of their retention period.
